result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Ryan Clausen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Ryan Clausen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark Ryan Clausen was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $275.05 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must maintain a full time job, school or job search/seek work.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

No drugs without a prescription. No drug paraphernalia.

No contact with Christopher Johanson.

Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting.

Must complete any other treatment or programming required by agent.

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

timeConds.notes:
Banked for use by Probation. Not subject to good time.
*Per Court Order 9/20/22: 30 days of jail time is to be released and served. Start date determined by the Department of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Ryan Clausen

and Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases- banked jail request

10:01 AM Defendant Mark Ryan Clausen in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Mark Ryan Clausen. Attorney David Stilin in court for State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. ADA to file amended information. On amended count 1 misd- def - G plea. CT accepts, adj G. Counts 2, 3 are dismissed on state's motion. Counsel stipulates to 1 day credit. Arguments. 

SENTENCE: W/held 1 year probation. Must report to probation today. 6 months stayed/banked jail. Not subj to GT. AODA and comply. Must maintain full time job or seek work or full time school. No drugs without a prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting.  No contact with Christopher Johanson. $10 fine plus costs plus surcharge, DNA surcharge, totaling $475.05. DNA sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC. Ftp- judgment. 1 day credit. Any other treatment/programming required by agent.10:16 am adj.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
from atty Schutte: Request for Plea and Sentencing hearing
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:47 AM Defendant Mark Ryan Clausen in court with attorney A.W. Schutte. Prosecuting Atty David Stilin appeared for State of Wisconsin.   AW- clerk.    State calls Officer  Rebhan S&T.  Identification made and venue established.   State rests.  Cross by Atty Schutte.  Witness released.  Ct- finds PC.  Def bound over.  Information filed.  Reading waived.  Defense is preserved for  15 days on Preargn rights.  DEF - NG plea, Ct accepts NG Plea.  
No substitutions expected.  Bond conts.  10:00 am adj  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.

11:34 AM Defendant Mark Ryan Clausen in court with attorney A.W. Schutte.  David Stilin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. AO-Clerk. Parties agree to rescheduling matter. Bond cont. 11:35 a.m. adj.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.
